title: Columbia's Last Flight
excerpt: The inside story of the investigation—and the catastrophe it laid bare

title: Gravity, Gizmos, and a Grand Theory of Interstellar Travel | WIRED
excerpt: For decades, Jim Woodward dreamed of a propellantless engine to take humans to the stars. Now he thinks he’s got it. But is it revolutionary—or illusory?

title: An Atlas of the Cosmos - Longreads
excerpt: We’ve mapped Mars, the Moon, the solar system, even our own galaxy. Which means there is only one thing left to understand in this symbolic way and that is the entirety of the cosmos.

title: The Planet Hunting Machine
excerpt: Caltech professor Gregg Hallinan and his team are scanning the universe for possible Earths with cheap antennae built from parts found online, cake pans, and, yes, chicken wire—taking the lonely search for habitable planets and automating it.

title: Speed Kills
excerpt: Development of hypersonics is moving so quickly that it threatens to outpace any real discussion about the potential perils of such weapons, including how they may disrupt efforts to avoid accidental conflict, especially during crises.

title: An Orbit Map of the Solar System
excerpt: A map of over 18,000 asteroids in the Solar System.

title: Q: Why was it so hard to take a picture of a black hole? What are we even looking at?
excerpt: Physicist: Black holes and space are both black, so there’s that.  But while black holes tend to be very small, space is bonkers big and filled with just enough stuff to give astronomers thin…

title: The Astronaut Who Might Actually Get Us to Mars – Texas Monthly
excerpt: As an eighteen-year-old immigrant to the U.S., Franklin Chang Díaz dreamed of becoming an astronaut. Now, decades after tying the record for most spaceflights, he might be the best bet to get us to Mars.

title: One night of telescope time rules out black hole/dark matter idea
excerpt: Black holes formed right after the Big Bang aren’t common enough to be dark matter.

title: Proof of life: how would we recognise an alien if we saw one?
excerpt: Proof of life: what evidence would it take to convince you that alien intelligence had been found?
